get.description:
This endpoint allows a user to determine what device (if any) is connected to a given peer device and peer
interface. This is useful in a situation where a device boots with no configuration, but can detect its neighbors
via a protocol such as LLDP. Two query parameters must be included in the request:

* `peer_device`: The name of the peer device
* `peer_interface`: The name of the peer interface

parameters.name: peer_device
parameters.description: The name of the peer device

parameters.name: peer_interface
parameters.description: The name of the peer interface

get.description:
A convenience method for returning available IP addresses within a prefix. By default, the number of IPs
returned will be equivalent to PAGINATE_COUNT. An arbitrary limit (up to MAX_PAGE_SIZE, if set) may be passed,
however results will not be paginated.

The advisory lock decorator uses a PostgreSQL advisory lock to prevent this API from being
invoked in parallel, which results in a race condition where multiple insertions can occur.

post.description:
A convenience method for returning available IP addresses within a prefix. By default, the number of IPs
returned will be equivalent to PAGINATE_COUNT. An arbitrary limit (up to MAX_PAGE_SIZE, if set) may be passed,
however results will not be paginated.

The advisory lock decorator uses a PostgreSQL advisory lock to prevent this API from being
invoked in parallel, which results in a race condition where multiple insertions can occur.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A unique integer value identifying this prefix.

get.summary: This endpoint can be used to generate a new RSA key pair. The keys are returned in PEM format.

post.description:
Retrieve a temporary session key to use for encrypting and decrypting secrets via the API. The user's private RSA
key is POSTed with the name `private_key`. An example:

    curl -v -X POST -H "Authorization: Token <token>" -H "Accept: application/json; indent=4" \
    --data-urlencode "private_key@<filename>" https://netbox/api/secrets/get-session-key/

This request will yield a base64-encoded session key to be included in an `X-Session-Key` header in future requests:

    {
        "session_key": "+8t4SI6XikgVmB5+/urhozx9O5qCQANyOk1MNe6taRf="
    }

This endpoint accepts one optional parameter: `preserve_key`. If True and a session key exists, the existing session
key will be returned instead of a new one.

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: id

label.title: Label
label.description: Name of the field as displayed to users (if not provided, the field's name will be used)

required.title: Required
required.description: If true, this field is required when creating new objects or editing an existing object.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value for the field (must be a JSON value). Encapsulate strings with double quotes (e.g. "Foo").

weight.title: Weight
weight.description: Fields with higher weights appear lower in a form.

validation_regex.title: Validation regex
validation_regex.description: Regular expression to enforce on text field values. Use ^ and $ to force matching of entire string. For example, ^[A-Z]{3}$ will limit values to exactly three uppercase letters.

choices.description: Comma-separated list of available choices (for selection fields)

required.title: Required

filter_logic.title: Filter logic
filter_logic.description: Loose matches any instance of a given string; exact matches the entire field.

default.title: Default

weight.title: Weight

choices.description: Comma-separated list of available choices (for selection fields)

link_text.title: Link text
link_text.description: Jinja2 template code for link text

link_url.title: Link URL
link_url.description: Jinja2 template code for link URL

group_name.title: Group name
group_name.description: Links with the same group will appear as a dropdown menu

button_class.title: Button class
button_class.description: The class of the first link in a group will be used for the dropdown button

new_window.title: New window
new_window.description: Force link to open in a new window

template_code.title: Template code
template_code.description: The list of objects being exported is passed as a context variable named queryset.

file_extension.title: File extension
file_extension.description: Extension to append to the rendered filename

changed_object.title: Changed object
changed_object.description: Serialize a nested representation of the changed object.

type_create.title: Type create
type_create.description: Call this webhook when a matching object is created.

type_update.title: Type update
type_update.description: Call this webhook when a matching object is updated.

type_delete.title: Type delete
type_delete.description: Call this webhook when a matching object is deleted.

payload_url.title: URL
payload_url.description: A POST will be sent to this URL when the webhook is called.

http_content_type.title: HTTP content type
http_content_type.description: The complete list of official content types is available here.

additional_headers.title: Additional headers
additional_headers.description: User-supplied HTTP headers to be sent with the request in addition to the HTTP content type. Headers should be defined in the format Name: Value. Jinja2 template processing is support with the same context as the request body (below).

body_template.title: Body template
body_template.description: Jinja2 template for a custom request body. If blank, a JSON object representing the change will be included. Available context data includes: event, model, timestamp, username, request_id, and data.

secret.title: Secret
secret.description: When provided, the request will include a 'X-Hook-Signature' header containing a HMAC hex digest of the payload body using the secret as the key. The secret is not transmitted in the request.

ssl_verification.title: SSL verification
ssl_verification.description: Enable SSL certificate verification. Disable with caution!

ca_file_path.title: CA File Path
ca_file_path.description: The specific CA certificate file to use for SSL verification. Leave blank to use the system defaults.

nat_inside.description: The IP for which this address is the "outside" IP
